citation.article-title: Staphylococcus lutrae sp. nov., a new coagulase-positive species isolated from otters.

p.s: Description of Staphylococcus lutrae sp. nov.
Staphylococcus lutrae (lu‘trae. L. fem. gen. n. lutrae, of an otter)
Cocci are arranged singly, in pairs, and in irregular clusters.
Colonies on P agar are circular, entire, low convex, smooth, glistening, opaque, nonpigmented, and 3.5 to 4.5 mm in diameter.
Grows in the presence of 10% but not in the presence of 15% NaCl.
Coagulase positive, but clumping factor is not produced.
Acid is produced from adonitol, dulcitol, galactose, glucose, inositol, lactose, maltose, mannose, sorbitol, trehalose, and xylose.
Sensitive to novobiocin, deferoxamine, and fosfomycin.
The G+C content of the DNA is 34 mol%.
Isolated from otters, for which it may be pathogenic.
